metadata.title: CVE-2023-5728 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
During garbage collection extra operations were performed on a object thatshould not be. This could have led to a potentially exploitable crash. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 119, Firefox ESR < 115.4, and Thunderbird <115.4.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-5728` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:115.4.1+build1-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:115.4.1+build1-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:115.4.1+build1-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:115.4.1+build1-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:115.4.1+build1-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:115.4.1+build1-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:115.4.1+build1-0ubuntu0.23.04.1').
mozjs78 package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs102 package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
